description: Comparative negligence - plaintiff partially at fault
facts: Driver A ran a stop sign
Driver B was speeding 20 mph over the limit
The two vehicles collided at an intersection
Jury found Driver A 70% at fault and Driver B 30% at fault
asp_facts: claim(c1). claim_type(c1, negligence). defendant(c1, driver_a). plaintiff(c1, driver_b). duty_owed(c1, yes). duty_breached(c1, yes). plaintiff_negligent(c1, yes). defendant_fault_percent(c1, 70). plaintiff_fault_percent(c1, 30). actual_cause(c1, yes). proximate_cause(c1, yes). damages(c1, 10000). injury_type(c1, property).
question: Can Driver B recover damages from Driver A?
rationale: Under comparative negligence, a plaintiff can recover damages reduced by their percentage of fault. Driver B can recover $7,000 (70% of $10,000) from Driver A since Driver B was only 30% at fault.
